meanings.definition: To cause or accelerate a reaction
meanings.sent1: Adding the enzyme can catalyse the breakdown of food.
meanings.sent2: The presence of sunlight can catalyse the growth of plants.
meanings.sent3: The chef's secret ingredient seemed to catalyse a frenzy of excitement among the diners.
meanings.sent4: Her infectious laughter seemed to catalyse joy in everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The sudden rainstorm catalysed chaos in the city streets.

meanings.sent1: The new policy change will catalyse innovation within the company.
meanings.sent2: His encouragement always seems to catalyse positive change in others.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected visitor seemed to catalyse a series of amusing events in the household.
meanings.sent4: Her smile acted as a catalyst, catalysing happiness in those around her.
meanings.sent5: The coach's pep talk catalysed determination in the team.

meanings.definition: To facilitate a process or change
meanings.sent1: The new technology will catalyse the efficiency of the production line.
meanings.sent2: Good communication can catalyse understanding between people.
meanings.sent3: The clown's antics somehow catalysed a chain of unexpected reactions at the party.
meanings.sent4: His leadership style catalysed a transformation in the organization.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's enthusiasm catalysed a love for learning in her students.
